discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Using a site-to-site VPN allows for two offices or data centers to communicate with each other over a secure connection making it the best choice for this question.

As for VNC, I believe its used just like RDP with the exception of it being more secure and also simply as a second option in the case that RDP isn't an option to use to connect to a desktop. 

SSH is a method of securely connecting to a device's CLI to make configuration changes or to simply check configs. SSH has many purposes but mostly it is used to connect to a foreign device without any GUI.

Selected Answer: D
Site-to-Site VPN connections are used to connect regional offices back to a main branch office.

Encapsulates entire packets & puts another header on top of them. This is going to increase the size of the packets that can meet the MTU. You readdress the packets with a header & then ship them to somebody else. The new header is going to have a new source & destination read by the VPN terminating devices located @ the different site that it is to going to. Once the packet reaches the other site, the VPN concentrator will remove the outer envelope of the header & therefore decapsulate the packets to be decrypted & routed across the LAN, just as if it was coming from an internally connected client.

This is better worded than my other. ^

Selected Answer: D
Site-to-site VPN connections are used to connect regional offices back to a main office.

This can be done by Tunneling Mode which encapsulates the entire packets & puts another header on top of it. This is going to increase the size of the packet & it can go over the MTU. You readdressed it & then ship it to somebody else. The new header is going to have a new source & destination of the VPN terminating devices at the different site that it wants to go to. Once the packet reaches the other site, the VPN concentrator will remove the outer envelope of the header inside of a network packet to be decrypted & routed across the private LAN, just as if it was coming from an internally connected client. To ensure packets make it through the VPN, you might need to allow jumbo frames, this should only be done on your LAN.

A user reports that a crucial fileshare is unreachable following a network upgrade that was completed the night before. A network technician confirms the problem exists. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should the network technician perform NEXT?

choices.B: Implement a solution to fix the problem.
choices.C: Create a plan of action to resolve the problem.
choices.A: Establish a theory of probable cause.
choices.D: Document the problem and the solution.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"following a network upgrade that was completed the night before." That's your probable cause. now C (create a plan of action)

comments.content: Yes and no. You'd still want to check the change management documentation to establish a theory of what part of the network change is the probable cause.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I asked ChatGPT which gave me generic C however this is a COMPTIA exam.
I asked BING AI which referenced Comptia websites 3 times to determine answer is. A!!

After confirming the problem, the next step in the troubleshooting process is to establish a theory of probable cause (Option A)12. This involves analyzing the information collected to get an idea of the type of problem, which assets it has affected, and even if it has been encountered in the past2. Once a probable cause has been established, the technician can then create a plan of action to resolve the problem, implement the solution, and document the problem and the solution3. So, the correct answer is Option A.

it's A. B is the fourth in TM. After the technician confirmed that the problem exists which is " network upgrade the night before". The next step will be "Establish a theory of probable cause".

Selected Answer: A
A. Establish a theory of probable cause.

Before implementing a solution or taking further actions, it's important to understand the potential causes of the problem. By establishing a theory of probable cause, the technician can narrow down possible explanations for the issue and gather more information to confirm or rule out those explanations. This step involves collecting data, analyzing logs, and conducting tests to identify the root cause of the problem.

Selected Answer: A
Cant assume anything. They did not say "his theory is the update caused the issue"... what about the update may have caused it? What else could have changed? There is no theory yet.

Selected Answer: C
He believes the update is the cause.

Selected Answer: A
A. Establish a theory of probable cause is the next troubleshooting step that the network technician should perform.

A. Establish a theory of probable cause

The 7 steps to troubleshooting are:
1. Identify the problem
2. Establish a theory of probable cause
3. Test the theory to determine the cause
4. Establish a plan of action to resolve the problem 
5. Implement the solution
6. Verify full system functionality, and, if applicable, implement preventive measures
7. Document findings, actions and outcomes

I think the assumption is, because a user was having an issue the technician verified that the issue was valid, so they are merely identifying that there is a problem. We aren't told that we know what the issue is, so the next step is likely to Establish a theory of probable cause. Knowing that there is an issue and knowing/guessing why the issue exists is where we need to differentiate.

comments.content: Problem was already identified, theory was established based on claims and tested, so therefore creating a plan of action is next, you played yourself

discussion.content: Obviously A - Just google the Comptia troubleshooting steps, it is obviously !

Selected Answer: C
C. Create a plan of action to resolve the problem should be the next troubleshooting step that the network technician should perform. This step involves creating a detailed plan for resolving the issue, which will help to ensure that the problem is addressed effectively and efficiently. The plan should include steps such as identifying the scope of the problem, gathering additional information as necessary, and developing a list of potential solutions.

questions.question_text:
A network engineer is designing a wireless network that has the following requirements:

• Network speed must be higher than 100Mbps
• Must use the 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands

Which of the following 802.11 standards should the engineer select?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Traffic shaping

Traffic shaping is a network management technique that controls the flow of network traffic to ensure that certain types of traffic are given higher priority over others. In this case, by implementing traffic shaping, the network engineer can prioritize and allocate sufficient bandwidth for the videoconferencing application to ensure its performance and quality.

Selected Answer: A
appropriate mechanism means Shaping while Link Aggregation is Protocol

Selected Answer: A
A. Traffic shaping is the "mechanism" to handle this

Selected Answer: A
In the scenario described, where the network engineer is dealing with poor performance on a videoconferencing application due to low available bandwidth at the WAN connection, the MOST appropriate mechanism to handle this issue would be Traffic Shaping.

comments.content:
Traffic shaping involves controlling and prioritizing network traffic to ensure that critical or time-sensitive applications, such as videoconferencing, receive sufficient bandwidth and consistent performance. It allows you to allocate bandwidth limits and priorities to different types of traffic, preventing bandwidth-hungry applications from overwhelming the connection and negatively impacting the performance of essential services.

With traffic shaping, the network engineer can:
Prioritize Videoconferencing: Allocate higher priority and sufficient bandwidth to the videoconferencing application, ensuring that it gets the required resources to function smoothly.
Limit Non-Essential Traffic: Throttle or limit the bandwidth for less critical applications, such as file downloads or streaming, which might be consuming excess bandwidth and causing congestion.
Maintain Quality of Service (QoS): Ensure that video and audio data packets are transmitted with minimal delay, jitter, and packet loss, preserving the quality of the videoconferencing experience.

Selected Answer: A
